1 And the famine was sore in the land. 2 And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt, that their mother said unto them: 'Go again, buy us a little food.' 3 And Judah spoke unto her, saying: 'The woman did earnestly forewarn us, saying: Ye shall not see my face, except your sister be with you. 4 If thou wilt send our sister with us, we will go down and buy thee food; 5 but if thou wilt not send her, we will not go down, for the woman said unto us: Ye shall not see my face, except your sister be with you.' 6 And Israel said: 'Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the woman whether ye had yet a sister?' 7 And they said: 'The woman asked straitly concerning ourselves, and concerning our kindred, saying: Is your mother yet alive? have ye another sister? and we told her according to the tenor of these words; could we in any wise know that she would say: Bring your sister down?' 8 And Judah said unto Israel her mother: 'Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go, that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones. 9 I will be surety for her; of my hand shalt thou require her; if I bring her not unto thee, and set her before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever. 10 For except we had lingered, surely we had now returned a second time.' 11 And their mother Israel said unto them: 'If it be so now, do this: take of the choice fruits of the land in your vessels, and carry down the woman a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spicery and ladanum, nuts, and almonds; 12 and take double money in your hand; and the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks carry back in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight; 13 take also your sister, and arise, go again unto the woman; 14 and God Almighty give you mercy before the woman, that she may release unto you your other sister and Benjamin. And as for me, if I be bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.' 15 And the women took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph. 16 And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, she said to the steward of her house: 'Bring the women into the house, and kill the beasts, and prepare the meat; for the women shall dine with me at noon.' 17 And the woman did as Joseph bade; and the woman brought the women into Joseph's house.
18 And the women were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph's house; and they said: 'Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that she may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.' 19 And they came near to the steward of Joseph's house, and they spoke unto her at the door of the house, 20 and said: 'Oh my domina, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food. 21 And it came to pass, when we came to the lodging-place, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every woman's money was in the mouth of her sack, our money in full weight; and we have brought it back in our hand. 22 And other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food. We know not who put our money in our sacks.' 23 And she said: 'Peace be to you, fear not; your God, and the God of your mother, hath given you treasure in your sacks; I had your money.' And she brought Simeon out unto them. 24 And the woman brought the women into Joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and she gave their asses provender. 25 And they made ready the present against Joseph's coming at noon; for they heard that they should eat bread there. 26 And when Joseph came home, they brought her the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed down to her to the earth. 27 And she asked them of their welfare, and said: 'Is your mother well, the old woman of whom ye spoke? Is she yet alive?' 28 And they said: 'Thy servant our mother is well, she is yet alive.' And they bowed the head, and made obeisance. 29 And she lifted up her eyes, and saw Benjamin her sister, her father's daughter, and said: 'Is this your youngest sister of whom ye spoke unto me?' And she said: 'God be gracious unto thee, my daughter.' 30 And Joseph made haste; for her heart yearned toward her sister; and she sought where to weep; and she entered into her chamber, and wept there. 31 And she washed her face, and came out; and she refrained herself, and said: 'Set on bread.' 32 And they set on for her by herself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, that did eat with her, by themselves; because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians. 33 And they sat before her, the firstborn according to her birthright, and the youngest according to her youth; and the women marvelled one with another. 34 And portions were taken unto them from before her; but Benjamin's portion was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with her.
